Author Colleen Walski Announcing her new book - Growing into Greatness

Growing into Greatness is Colleen’s first inspiring and thought provoking book debut.  A soulful story of resilience and purpose that began on an intended journey of re-building hope after her only son, Scott tragically passed.  The transformative power of selfless service is revealed as she finds the universe has oddly aligned the destiny of many to make an inspiring impact that continues to enrich the fortune of Scott's legacy and hers!As the Founder & CEO of Scott Foundation, her inspiration comes from a "knowing" the world needs something different.  In her search for answers - reflection, shocking facts about systems that serve our children, insightful social beliefs supporting nonprofits, along with her very clear and mindful vision of the future on the need to grow our next generation Thought & Service Leaders.Learn more about www.Scott-Foundation.org
Author Colleen Walski, Announcing her new book Growing into Greatness
Author Colleen Walski, Announcing her new book Growing into Greatness

As the Executive Director of Scott Foundation, Colleen serves as the organization’s key spokesperson and has the primary responsibility for fund development and overall oversight of the organization’s business. She is responsible for financial and fiscal management of operations including providing strategic leadership and establishing long-range planning.Colleen serves as an active community member providing ongoing leadership in humanitarian services to local children programs with ongoing commitment to increase awareness and support of community partnerships. Her professional experience prior to Scott Foundation includes over 20 years of senior level leadership, operations and project management with Intel Corporation. Diverse entrepreneurial experience the following ten years continues to demonstrate her key strengths represented in the accomplishments throughout her professional career. She is described as a very results-driven, well organized Leader by her peers, providing strategic vision with excellent interpersonal and analytical skills.

recommendations: Tina Woodard
Manager, People Advisory Services
December 17, 2014, Tina worked with Colleen in the same group

It is a privilege to be recommending Tina Woodard, as she is perhaps one of the most exceptional women I have ever known.  Tina was essential in the long-term success of the Information Management and Business Systems groups’ program delivery.  Her positive attitude, strategic vision and dedication to mission served her and the team well.  Tina has the ability to work together as a team taking direction from others if needed, or instinctively stepping forward to lead and influence the team for the greater good.It is clear that Tina’s high standard of excellence and initiative will serve her to succeed in anything she sets her mind too.  However, once you know her personal attributes and attitude towards life, you will realize that Tina is not a typical member of staff.  Tina is a leader in everything she does, and she will definitely be a factor in the advancement of her profession.I am honored to personally recommend Tina and more than happy to associate SCOTT Foundation with future programs she may be involved in!

Jason Rodie
Life Style Vlogger, Coach, Athlete, Creator of The Limp That Is not Eazy
December 10, 2014, Colleen worked with Jason but at different companies

It is a distinct privilege to write a recommendation for Jason Rodie, as he is perhaps one of the most exceptional young men I have ever known.  Inspiring, uplifting and courageous are the words that immediately come to mind to describe him.  Jason’s positive attitude and dedication to task and vision serve him well.  I have been in several settings, observing first hand Jason’s ability to work together as a team taking direction from others, or instinctively stepping forward to lead and influence a team for the greater good.  Jason’s choice to overcome the odds in life, exemplify the message to others on “living life on purpose”.  I would be more than honored to associate our Foundation with future programs he may be involved in.

June 21, 2012, Colleen was a client of Cari’s

Scott Helping Children Foundation is very proud to be associated with Cari Campbell & Associates.  Cari leads a very professional and personable  team that clearly demonstrate a shared vision and interest in supporting the greater good of their customers.  More specifically the detail their service provides not only addresses the customers needs but their professional efforts are apparent in further educating their customers for long-term success.  Thanks again Cari & Team!

summary: Colleen Walski serves as the Executive Director for Scott Foundation. She is dynamically involved in the development and oversight of her sons growing non-profit organization which is dedicated to "Growing next generation Thought & Service Leaders".Scott Foundation is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that invests in the 4-year future of Arizona foster kids who wish to make the world better than they found it.  The foundation produces year-round experiential programming that highlights, inspires and educate kids on the importance of social emotional well-being, while mindfully developing their heart and purposeful career path. Motivated by tragedy, kids transform to find their true self and become self-supporting, successful, community-minded, "whole-people“.With a focus on developing inner wealth, we believe in making the world a more peaceful and loving place by emotionally teaching kids to make better choices through selfless service.
name: Colleen Walski
title: Scott's Mom, Author, Founder & CEO of Scott Foundation
